intro: Scholtzia kalbarri, commonly known as the Kalbarri sunflower, is an annual plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces numerous small seeds that are dispersed by wind. Scholtzia kalbarri is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
